intro: Aequatorium verrucosum, commonly known as the warty liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its leafy, thalloid structure covered with small, warty bumps, which give it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette pattern and are often green or reddish in color. Aequatorium verrucosum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
